body: How does the test fix the issue? I assume step 9 is the problem.

issue.title: Changes to ignored files should not result in out of sync (reproduces #1701)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I cleaned up the previous PR too much which meant the bug wasn't triggered. This reproduces #1701 with the following findings:

`leveldb.go:889: DEBUG: need folder="default" device=7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-77777Q4 name="testfile.txt" need=false have=false haveV=[] globalV=[{5157751870738175669 1}]`

`{Name:"testfile.txt", Size:14, Flags:"0664", Modified:time.Time{sec:63567486913, nsec:0, loc:(*time.Location)(0x9d1e80)}, Localversion:891, Version:[]string{"5157751870738175669:1"}}}, Total:1, Page:1, Perpage:65536}`

body:
I also notice that the debug output is somewhat misleading in this circumstance when the "Override changes" button is pressed. "Excluded file.txt" is in the same situation as this issue's "Test1.txt" file:

model.go:1049: DEBUG: not sending update for ignored/unsupported symlink File{Name:"Excluded file.txt", Flags:020644, Modified:1441710228, Version:[{8709063819142425859 4}], Size:0, Blocks:[]}
It says that symlinks are not handled because you are not running as admin. This has nothing todo with this issue.

I should have clarified - the file is not a symlink, nor are there any symlinks in the shared folder. It's just a normal file that is:
- Matched by an ignore pattern
- Present on the device, which is a Master
- Present on another device

Right, sorry, misread the error message. It's simply ignored.

But I still don't understand why you think the output misleading?
Ah my apologies, I assumed it meant "ignored or unsupported symlink", where it's saying "ignored file or unsupported symlink"...whoops.

This is a straight up bug of some kind, unrelated to master mode. Simpler reproduction:
- Two clean nodes, A and B
- Create test1.txt on A, let it sync to B
- Ignore test1.txt on A
- Change test1.txt on B

A is out of sync.

Index on A when it's idle/disconnected/looks happy:

```
$ stindex h1/index-v0.11.0.db
Path: h1/index-v0.11.0.db
[device] F:"default" N:"test1.txt" D:7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-77777Q4
  N:"test1.txt"
  F:020644
  M:1448192628
  V:[{5157751870738175669 1} {11395144714346075690 1}]
  S:0
  B:0
```

Note that test1.txt has the invalid bit set.

Index on A when it's connected to B, out of sync:

```
$ stindex h1/index-v0.11.0.db
Path: h1/index-v0.11.0.db
[device] F:"default" N:"test1.txt" D:JMFJCXB-GZDE4BN-OCJE3VF-65GYZNU-AIVJRET-3J6HMRQ-AUQIGJO-FKNHMQU
  N:"test1.txt"
  F:0644
  M:1448192628
  V:[{11395144714346075690 1}]
  S:4
  B:1
[device] F:"default" N:"test1.txt" D:7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-777777N-7777777-77777Q4
  N:"test1.txt"
  F:020644
  M:1448192628
  V:[{5157751870738175669 1} {11395144714346075690 1}]
  S:0
  B:0
[global] F:"default" N:"test1.txt" V:00000001000000019e23afbe5ec4962a0000000000000001000000204b0a915c26c8c9c0b84926ea5f74d8cb408aa6249ed3e3b220a41064b8aa69d9
```

Note that it's accepted test1.txt into the global list. Not sure why it did that.

The current handling of incoming ignored entries is crap. Should we set an `ignored` bit in the flag set, that is not sent anywhere else? Introduce a field in `FileInfo` for "local flags" that are not part of the protocol?
In completion et al we never check the flags, which I think is the issue.
